top_categories.workout_context: 150 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Red Granite Grinder's Wisconsin rolling gravel—fall farmland rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Red Granite Grinder's Wisconsin gravel roads (90%), Dirt roads (10%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 150 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Red Granite Grinder's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
150 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
When someone attacks on Wisconsin rolling gravel—fall farmland, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Red Granite Grinder. Train it until it feels boring.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 150 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Long rides with hard efforts mixed in. Simulates what Red Granite Grinder's Wisconsin rolling gravel—fall farmland actually does to you.
At Red Granite Grinder, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Red Granite Grinder, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Tempo is Red Granite Grinder's race pace. The wattage you'll hold for 150 miles on Wisconsin rolling gravel—fall farmland. Train it until it's automatic.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 150 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 150 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Red Granite Grinder requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on wisconsin rolling gravel—fall farmland to build confidence. Expect: wisconsin gravel roads (90%), dirt roads (10%), rolling farmland.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 150 miles of wisconsin rolling gravel—fall farmland in Athens, Wisconsin (Central Wisconsin).
